USA: Parliament enacted the Stamp Act 1765, imposing a tax on many types of printed materials used in the colonies.
Parliament enacted the Quartering Act, requiring the Thirteen Colonies to provide housing, food, and other provisions to British troops.
Virginia's House of Burgesses adopted the Virginia Resolves, which claimed that under English law Virginians could be taxed only by an assembly to which they had elected representatives.
Stamp Act Congress: A congress of delegates from nine colonies adopted the Declaration of Rights and Grievances, which petitioned Parliament and the King to repeal the Stamp Act.
